Original: ['PHNOM PENH (Reuters) - Sweden said on Tuesday it was stopping new aid for Cambodia, except in education and research, and would no longer support a reform programme after the main opposition party was outlawed by the Supreme Court at the government s request.', 'Sweden, which has given Cambodia an estimated $100 million in aid over five years, ranked third among individual EU member states in Cambodia s database of donors last year, after France and Germany.']
Paraphrased: ["Sweden has decided to discontinue its new aid for Cambodia, with the exception of education and research, and will no longer support the country's reform program due to the Supreme Court's recent ban on the main opposition party at the government's request.", "Sweden ranked third among individual EU member states in Cambodia's donor database last year, having provided an estimated $100 million in aid over five years, behind only France and Germany."]

Original: ['UNITED NATIONS (Reuters) - United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres  counts on the Security Council to remain united and take appropriate action  on North Korea, his political affairs chief, Jeffrey Feltman, said on Monday after Pyongyang conducted its sixth nuclear test.', 'The latest serious developments require a comprehensive response in order to break the cycle of provocations from (North Korea).']
Paraphrased: ["According to the United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres' political affairs chief, Jeffrey Feltman, the Security Council is expected to maintain unity and take appropriate measures in response to North Korea's recent nuclear test.", 'The current situation demands a thorough and multifaceted approach to address the escalating tensions and prevent further provocations from (North Korea).']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Republicans in U.S. House of Representatives began staking out their positions on final tax legislation on Tuesday, days ahead of talks with the Senate to shape the tax package lawmakers hope to send to President Donald Trump by year end.', 'While lawmakers expect a smooth reconciliation of rival House and Senate tax bills, House Republicans have taken issue with several items in the Senate’s legislation - from a one-year delay in cutting the corporate tax rate to 20 percent to the sunsetting of individual tax cuts after 2025.']
Paraphrased: ['Republican members of the U.S. House of Representatives began outlining their positions on the final tax legislation on Tuesday, in preparation for upcoming negotiations with the Senate. The goal is to shape a tax package that lawmakers hope to send to President Donald Trump by the end of the year.', "Despite expectations of a harmonious reconciliation, House Republicans have expressed dissatisfaction with several aspects of the Senate's tax legislation, including a one-year delay in reducing the corporate tax rate to 20% and the temporary nature of individual tax cuts beyond 2025."]

Original: ['MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russia has suspended its diplomatic presence in Yemen and all its staff have left the country due to the situation in the capital Sanaa, the RIA news agency cited Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova as saying on Tuesday.', 'The Russian ambassador to Yemen and some diplomatic staff will be working temporarily out of the Saudi capital Riyadh, the Interfax news agency cited the ministry as saying.']
Paraphrased: ['According to Russian Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova, Russia has temporarily withdrawn its diplomatic personnel from Yemen due to the unstable situation in the capital city of Sanaa, as reported by RIA news agency on Tuesday.', 'According to the Interfax news agency, the Russian ambassador to Yemen and some of his diplomatic staff will be temporarily relocated to Riyadh, the capital of Saudi Arabia, as cited by the ministry.']

Original: ['BRUSSELS (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump is strongly committed to working with the European Union toward common objectives of peace and prosperity, U.S. Vice President Mike Pence said on Monday.', '“Today is my privilege on behalf of President Trump to express the strong commitment of the United States to continue cooperation and partnership with the European Union,” Pence said in a statement read out after his meeting with European Council President Donald Tusk.']
Paraphrased: ['According to U.S. Vice President Mike Pence, President Donald Trump is fully dedicated to collaborating with the European Union in pursuit of shared goals of stability and economic growth.', '"I am honored to speak on behalf of President Trump today in expressing the United States\' unwavering dedication to collaborating with the European Union, and we look forward to maintaining our strong partnership in the future."']

Original: ['Trump has made clear that he doesn’t view the fight against Assad as a U.S. priority.', 'And once he’s in office, Trump will discover that fighting and containing Islamic State inevitably means wading into Syria’s complicated war.']
Paraphrased: ['Trump has indicated that the conflict in Syria is not a top priority for him in terms of U.S. involvement.', "Once Trump assumes the presidency, he will realize that combating and limiting the influence of the Islamic State in Syria will inevitably involve becoming entangled in the country's intricate and complex conflict."]

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell told President Barack Obama’s Supreme Court nominee Merrick Garland by phone on Wednesday that Republicans will not act on his nomination or meet with him, a McConnell spokesman said.”Rather than put Judge Garland through more unnecessary political routines orchestrated by the White House, the leader decided it would be more considerate of the nominee’s time to speak with him today by phone,” McConnell spokesman Don Stewart said in a statement.', 'McConnell told the appellate court judge that “since the Senate will not be acting on this nomination, he would not be holding a perfunctory meeting, but he wished Judge Garland well,” Stewart added.']
Paraphrased: ["Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell notified President Obama's Supreme Court nominee Merrick Garland by phone on Wednesday that Republicans will not consider his nomination or meet with him. McConnell made this decision to avoid subjecting Garland to unnecessary political rituals orchestrated by the White House, and instead chose to speak with him directly by phone out of respect for his time.", 'According to Stewart, McConnell informed the appellate court judge that he would not be conducting a formal meeting for the nomination since the Senate was not taking action, but he offered his well wishes to Judge Garland.']

Original: ['(Reuters) - A Michigan judge on Tuesday dismissed charges against a former state representative, while ruling another lawmaker should stand trial after he tried to hide their extramarital affair, according to a prosecutor’s office spokeswoman.', 'Prosecutors will not appeal the dismissed charges against Gamrat, but they are reviewing their options regarding the charges against Courser that were not sent to trial, Bitely said.']
Paraphrased: ["A Michigan judge dismissed the charges against a former state representative on Tuesday, while ruling that another lawmaker should stand trial for attempting to cover up their extramarital affair, according to a spokeswoman for the prosecutor's office.", 'Prosecutors have decided not to pursue an appeal for the dismissed charges against Gamrat, but they are assessing their options for the charges against Courser that were not sent to trial, according to Bitely.']

Original: ['TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan Airlines Co (9201.T) said on Monday it has begun screening passengers from the seven Muslim-majority countries affected by the President Donald Trump’s travel ban before their departure for the United States.', 'Officials at Japan’s second biggest carrier will contact the U.S. Customs and Border Protection agency when passengers from those countries check in at the airport before departure to confirm whether they will be allowed entry, a spokesman for the airline said.']
Paraphrased: ["Japan Airlines has started screening passengers from seven Muslim-majority countries before they depart for the United States, in response to President Donald Trump's travel ban.", "According to a spokesman for the airline, officials at Japan's second largest carrier will verify the eligibility of passengers from specific countries before they depart by contacting the U.S. Customs and Border Protection agency."]

Original: ['GENEVA (Reuters) - President Joseph Kabila has agreed to help aid reach a region of the Democratic Republic of Congo where ethnic conflict has spawned a humanitarian emergency, the head of the U.N. s World Food Programme said on Monday.', 'Beasley, a former governor of the U.S. state of South Carolina, told Congo s prime minister that WFP had paid the government $9 million in administrative fees  just for access, just for being here , and asked him to scrap the fees.']
Paraphrased: ['According to the head of the United Nations World Food Programme, President Joseph Kabila has consented to provide assistance in reaching a region of the Democratic Republic of Congo where a humanitarian crisis has arisen due to ethnic conflicts.', 'Beasley, a former governor of South Carolina, urged the Congolese prime minister to eliminate administrative fees totaling $9 million that the World Food Program (WFP) had paid to the government for access to the country, as he believed the fees were unnecessary.']

Original: ['The endorsement gives Trump a further lift before next week’s Super Tuesday nominating contests.', 'Rubio’s home state of Florida is not part of the Super Tuesday contests.']
Paraphrased: ["The endorsement provides an additional boost to Trump's campaign ahead of the upcoming Super Tuesday primaries.", 'Florida, where Rubio hails from, is not among the states participating in the Super Tuesday primaries.']

Original: ['COPENHAGEN (Reuters) - Iceland will hold a snap parliamentary election on Oct. 28, President Gudni Johannesson said on Monday, after the current government collapsed last week due to a scandal involving the prime minister s father.', 'The outgoing government would be the shortest-living in Iceland s history.']
Paraphrased: ["REYKJAVIK (Reuters) - Iceland will hold an unexpected parliamentary election on October 28th, following the collapse of the current government last week due to a scandal involving the prime minister's father.", "The recently departed government was the shortest-serving in Iceland's history."]

Original: ['Stripped of Ukrainian citizenship while on a trip abroad, he  will try to re-enter Ukraine via the Polish border on Sunday, his staff and lawyers say, and expects to be greeted by supporters and lawmakers sympathetic to his cause.', 'The Kiev police ensured the delivery of the Georgian citizen to the migration services,  he told news agency Interfax Ukraine.']
Paraphrased: ['After being stripped of his Ukrainian citizenship while abroad, he plans to re-enter Ukraine through the Polish border on Sunday, according to his staff and lawyers. He expects to be met with support from supporters and lawmakers who share his perspective.', 'The Kiev police facilitated the transfer of the Georgian national to the migration authorities, as reported to Interfax Ukraine.']

Original: ['Such an assumption is common in career fields dominated by men.', 'With presumptive Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton seeking to become the first to break that barrier, several women in career fields made up mostly of men told Reuters that they saw her candidacy as significant.']
Paraphrased: ['Assumptions that are prevalent in male-dominated industries often perpetuate gender biases.', "Hillary Clinton's bid to become the first female president has inspired many women in traditionally male-dominated fields, who view her candidacy as a milestone for gender equality, according to Reuters."]

Original: ['Opening a critical Communist Party congress, Xi pledged to build a  modern socialist country  for a  new era  that will be proudly Chinese and steadfastly ruled by the party but open to the world.', 'We must unwaveringly uphold and improve party leadership and make the party still stronger.']
Paraphrased: ['At the start of a significant Communist Party congress, Xi promised to construct a contemporary socialist nation for a new era that will be distinctly Chinese, yet open to the world and firmly governed by the party.', "Maintaining and enhancing the party's leadership requires unwavering commitment and effort to make the party even stronger."]

Original: ['ROME/TUNIS (Reuters) - A powerful armed group, known for smuggling people from Libya, is seeking legitimacy and state security jobs from the Tripoli government in exchange for stopping migrant boats from leaving the coast of Sabratha for Italy, a senior group member said.', 'We only have deals with the (Tripoli) government,  Mohamed said.']
Paraphrased: ['The Tripoli government is being asked by a powerful armed group, notorious for smuggling people from Libya, to grant them official legitimacy and security positions in exchange for halting the departure of migrant boats from the coast of Sabratha bound for Italy.', 'Mohamed emphasized that their company only conducts business with the Tripoli government.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Donald Trump on Wednesday moved a step closer to fulfilling his campaign promise to reform the troubled Veterans Affairs department, but some veterans groups are concerned that the administration may be working toward privatizing their healthcare.', 'Trump signed a law extending the pilot “Veterans Choice” program, which allows some veterans to receive healthcare from local doctors and hospitals closer to their homes than the VA’s 150 hospitals and nearly 1,000 outpatient clinics.']
Paraphrased: ['President Trump took a step forward in fulfilling his campaign pledge to overhaul the embattled Veterans Affairs department, but some veteran organizations are apprehensive that the administration might be aiming to privatize their healthcare.', 'President Trump enacted a legislation that prolongs the "Veterans Choice" program, enabling certain veterans to receive medical care from nearby community doctors and hospitals instead of the VA\'s extensive network of 150 hospitals and nearly 1,000 outpatient clinics.']

Original: ['LONDON (Reuters) - British police said a bomb was used during an explosion at a London metro station which injured 18 people in what officers described as a  terrorist incident.', 'London s police is being supported by Britain s MI5 intelligence service, he said.']
Paraphrased: ['According to British police, a bomb was responsible for an explosion at a London metro station that injured 18 people, with officers describing the incident as a terrorist attack.', "London's law enforcement agencies are receiving backing from Britain's MI5 intelligence service, according to the speaker."]

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Congress on Wednesday overwhelmingly approved and sent to President Barack Obama legislation preventing government shutdowns at the end of this week by temporarily funding federal agencies through Dec. 9.', 'Final action in Congress came when the House of Representatives overwhelmingly approved the bill.']
Paraphrased: ['The U.S. Congress has decisively passed and sent to President Barack Obama a bill preventing imminent government shutdowns by providing temporary funding for federal agencies until December 9.', 'The House of Representatives passed the bill with an overwhelming majority.']

Original: ['(Reuters) - New York state Attorney General Eric Schneiderman intends to sue the federal government if Republican lawmakers pass proposed legislation to overhaul the U.S. healthcare system, his office said on Monday.', 'A group of Democrats led by Schneiderman and California Attorney General Xavier Becerra earlier this year sought to intervene in a pending lawsuit in order to defend subsidies paid to health insurers under Obamacare.']
Paraphrased: ["New York state Attorney General Eric Schneiderman plans to take legal action against the federal government if Republican lawmakers pass a bill to revamp the US healthcare system, according to his office's statement on Monday.", 'A group of Democratic lawmakers, led by Eric Schneiderman and California Attorney General Xavier Becerra, attempted to join a pending lawsuit earlier this year to defend the government subsidies provided to health insurers under the Affordable Care Act.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Donald Trump picked a new fight on Thursday with his fellow Republicans, saying congressional leaders could have avoided a “mess” over raising the U.S. debt ceiling if they had taken his advice.', 'Could have been so easy-now a mess!” Trump said in Twitter posts.']
Paraphrased: ['President Trump accused Congressional leaders of creating a "mess" by not following his guidance when raising the U.S. debt ceiling, picking a new fight with his own party on Thursday.', '"It could have been a straightforward situation, but now it\'s a complicated mess, according to Trump\'s tweets."']

Original: ['King Salman, the first sitting Saudi monarch ever to visit Russia, led a delegation to Moscow that agreed joint investment deals worth several billion dollars, providing much-needed investment for a Russian economy battered by low oil prices and Western sanctions.', 'His Saudi counterpart, Adel al-Jubeir, said new horizons had opened for Russia-Saudi ties that he could not previously have imagined.']
Paraphrased: ['King Salman, the first Saudi monarch to ever visit Russia while in power, brought a delegation to Moscow that finalized joint investment agreements totaling several billion dollars, providing much-needed financial support for the Russian economy, which has been struggling due to low oil prices and international sanctions.', 'Adel al-Jubeir revealed that previously unforeseeable opportunities had arisen for Russia-Saudi relations, marking a significant shift in their bilateral ties.']

Original: ['MUNICH (Reuters) - U.S. Republican senators plan to introduce legislation to impose further sanctions on Iran, accusing it of violating U.N. Security Council resolutions by testing ballistic missiles and acting to “destabilise” the Middle East, a U.S. senator said Sunday.', '“There’s going to be a conversation about what the proportional response is,” Murphy said, referring to Iran’s missile test.']
Paraphrased: ['U.S. Republican senators are preparing to introduce legislation that would impose additional sanctions on Iran, citing alleged violations of United Nations Security Council resolutions through its testing of ballistic missiles and actions that are believed to destabilize the Middle East region.', '"According to Murphy, there will be a discussion about the appropriate level of retaliation in response to Iran\'s recent missile test."']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Donald Trump will honor a U.S. agreement with Australia to accept refugees housed on islands off that country’s coast although he is unhappy about the deal, the White House said on Thursday.', '“The deal that was cut by the last administration is something that he’s extremely, extremely upset with,” White House spokesman Sean Spicer said at a news briefing.']
Paraphrased: ['President Trump will fulfill a commitment to accept refugees from Australia, despite his misgivings about the agreement, as stated by the White House on Thursday.', '"The previous administration\'s agreement left the current White House official extremely displeased."']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The new U.S. administration of President Donald Trump said on Friday its trade strategy to protect American jobs would start with withdrawal from the 12-nation Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) trade pact.', 'A White House statement issued soon after Trump’s inauguration said the United States would also “crack down on those nations that violate trade agreements and harm American workers in the process.” The statement said Trump was committed to renegotiating another trade deal, the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), which was signed in 1994 by the United States, Canada and Mexico.']
Paraphrased: ['The Trump administration announced on Friday that its plan to safeguard American employment would begin with the withdrawal of the United States from the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) trade agreement, which involves 12 countries.', 'The Trump administration vowed to take a tough stance on countries that breach trade agreements and harm American workers, with a focus on renegotiating the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) signed in 1994 by the US, Canada, and Mexico.']

Original: ['ISLAMABAD (Reuters) - The Khyber Pass border between Pakistan and Afghanistan was closed to all traffic on Tuesday for the return of a Pakistani diplomat who was shot dead in Afghanistan by unknown gunmen.', 'The Pakistan-Afghanistan border was closed for all types of traffic.']
Paraphrased: ['Pakistan and Afghanistan closed the Khyber Pass border on Tuesday to all traffic, as a Pakistani diplomat who was killed by unknown gunmen in Afghanistan was returned to Pakistan.', 'The frontier between Pakistan and Afghanistan was shut down for all forms of transportation.']

Original: ['NEW YORK (Reuters) - A meeting in New York on Thursday between U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe has ended, a Trump transition team official said.', 'The hastily arranged meeting was an attempt to smooth relations following Trump’s campaign rhetoric that cast doubt on long-standing U.S. alliances.']
Paraphrased: ["A meeting between U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe in New York on Thursday has concluded, according to an official from Trump's transition team.", "The impromptu gathering aimed to mitigate tensions after Trump's election platform raised concerns about the stability of traditional U.S. alliances."]

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Democratic Party communications director Luis Miranda is expected to leave the Democratic National Committee on Tuesday amid fallout from the party’s email hacking scandal, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.']
Paraphrased: ["According to a source familiar with the matter, Luis Miranda, the communications director for the Democratic Party, is expected to depart the Democratic National Committee on Tuesday, amidst the ongoing fallout from the party's email hacking scandal."]

Original: ['LOUISVILLE, Ky. (Reuters) - Officials for a Kentucky county will appeal a federal judge’s ruling that invalidated its right-to-work law, the county’s lawyer said on Thursday.', 'The ruling affects only Hardin County in north-central Kentucky, one of 12 to have passed a right-to-work law.']
Paraphrased: ["The county's lawyer has announced that they will challenge a recent federal judge's decision that deemed their right-to-work law invalid.", 'The court decision only applies to Hardin County in north-central Kentucky, one of twelve states that have enacted right-to-work laws.']

Original: ['THE HAGUE (Reuters) - After blocking U.N. Security Council action against Syria, Russia has proposed changing the rules for inspectors at the world s chemical weapons body in The Hague, a move Western diplomats and experts said would undermine its work.', 'Syria denied using chemical weapons.']
Paraphrased: ["Russia, after thwarting UN Security Council action against Syria, has suggested altering the rules for inspectors at the international chemical weapons watchdog in The Hague, a move that Western diplomats and experts believe would weaken the organization's effectiveness.", 'Syria refuted allegations of using chemical weapons.']

Original: ['(Reuters) - Highlights of the day for U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration on Friday: Trump backs a decision by his former national security adviser, Michael Flynn, to seek immunity in congressional investigations of possible ties between his campaign and Russia, but there is no immediate sign the request will be granted.', 'Trump will seek to rebuild the U.S. relationship with Egypt at a meeting on Monday with Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi focused on security issues and military aid, a senior White House official says.']
Paraphrased: ["According to Reuters, on Friday, the highlights of U.S. President Donald Trump's administration included his support for his former national security adviser, Michael Flynn, who has sought immunity in congressional investigations into potential connections between the campaign and Russia. However, there is no indication that the request will be granted immediately.", 'The Trump administration plans to revitalize the partnership between the US and Egypt during a meeting on Monday with Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, with a primary focus on security matters and military assistance, according to a senior White House official.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Democratic presidential front-runner Hillary Clinton on Tuesday released her personal financial disclosure form, covering Jan. 1, 2015, to the present, with a call to Republican Donald Trump to make available his income tax returns.', 'Clinton’s own disclosure form showed more than $5 million in royalties from her memoir “Hard Choices.” Trump earlier in the day announced that he had filed his personal financial disclosure to the Federal Election Commission on Monday.']
Paraphrased: ['Hillary Clinton, the leading Democratic presidential candidate, revealed her personal financial disclosure form on Tuesday, spanning from January 1, 2015, to the present, and urged her Republican rival Donald Trump to disclose his income tax returns.', 'According to Clinton\'s financial disclosure form, she earned over $5 million in royalties from her memoir "Hard Choices," while Trump revealed that he had submitted his personal financial disclosure to the Federal Election Commission on Monday.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Thursday said Republican senators are making “good progress” on their efforts to come to agreement on retooled draft legislation aimed at repealing and replacing the 2010 Affordable Care Act.', 'U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan separately on Thursday told reporters at a news conference that he expects his chamber to move quickly once the Senate passes its version of healthcare legislation.']
Paraphrased: ['According to U.S. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Thursday, Republican senators are making significant headway in revising their draft legislation aimed at repealing and replacing the Affordable Care Act, with McConnell describing their progress as "good."', 'Speaker Paul Ryan anticipates that the House of Representatives will proceed expeditiously once the Senate passes its version of the healthcare bill.']

Original: ['LONDON (Reuters) - British Prime Minister Theresa May raised concerns about illegal settlements on Thursday at a meeting with her Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu in London, May s office said.', 'They discussed the need to overcome obstacles to peace, with the prime minister noting our grave concerns about illegal settlements,  a spokesman from May s office said in a statement.']
Paraphrased: ["Theresa May expressed reservations about unauthorized Israeli settlements during a meeting with Benjamin Netanyahu in London, according to a statement released by May's office.", 'The prime minister and other officials talked about the challenges that must be overcome in order to achieve peace, with a specific focus on the illegal settlements that are a major source of concern.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Donald Trump on Wednesday seized on the deadly New York City truck attack to step up demands for stricter U.S. immigration laws, asking Congress to end a visa program that let the Uzbek suspect into the country and saying he might send him to Guantanamo Bay.', 'Trump on Wednesday also renewed his call for a “merit-based” visa system - which would favor the highly skilled - and for ending “chain migration,” which allows legal immigrants to apply for relatives abroad to come to the United States.']
Paraphrased: ['President Trump took advantage of the deadly truck attack in New York City to renew his call for tougher immigration laws, urging Congress to abolish a visa program that allowed the Uzbek suspect to enter the country and suggesting that he might send the suspect to the Guantanamo Bay detention center.', 'Trump on Wednesday reiterated his proposal for a "skill-based" visa system that prioritizes highly qualified applicants, and he also urged an end to "family chain migration," which enables legal immigrants to sponsor relatives living abroad for U.S. residency.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. foreign service has seen its top ranks shrink under Secretary of State Rex Tillerson, according to a letter written by the head of the union representing U.S. diplomats and seen by Reuters on Wednesday.', 'Were the U.S. military to face such a decapitation of its leadership ranks, I would expect a public outcry,” Stephenson said in the letter to members of the union.']
Paraphrased: ["According to a letter written by the head of the union representing U.S. diplomats and seen by Reuters on Wednesday, the top ranks of the U.S. foreign service have experienced significant reductions under Secretary of State Rex Tillerson's tenure.", "If the U.S. military were to experience a significant loss of leadership, there would likely be widespread public outrage, according to Stephenson's letter to union members."]

Original: ['JERUSALEM (Reuters) - Israel wants to name a train station after Donald Trump to thank him for recognizing Jerusalem as its capital, but the site of the planned building could be as divisive as the U.S. president s declaration.', 'I have decided to name the Western Wall station ... after U.S. President Donald Trump for his courageous and historic decision to recognize Jerusalem as the capital of the Jewish people and the State of Israel,  Katz said in a statement.']
Paraphrased: ["Israel is considering naming a train station after Donald Trump as a gesture of gratitude for his recognition of Jerusalem as the country's capital, but the proposed location may be met with controversy, much like Trump's own declaration.", 'Katz has chosen to name the Western Wall station after U.S. President Donald Trump in recognition of his bold and momentous decision to acknowledge Jerusalem as the capital of the Jewish people and the State of Israel.']

Original: ['LONDON (Reuters) - Britain s parliament backed a second reading of legislation to sever ties with the European Union early on Tuesday, a reprieve for Prime Minister Theresa May who now faces demands by lawmakers for concessions before it becomes law.', 'The bill seeks largely to  copy and paste  EU law into British legislation to ensure Britain has functioning laws and the same regulatory framework as the bloc at the moment of Brexit, to offer some reassurance for companies.']
Paraphrased: ["Britain's parliament approved the initial stage of a bill to end its membership in the European Union on Tuesday, providing a temporary respite for Prime Minister Theresa May, who must now address lawmakers' demands for concessions before the bill can become law.", "The proposed legislation primarily aims to incorporate existing EU laws into British statutes, providing a stable legal framework for businesses and ensuring continuity upon the country's withdrawal from the EU."]

Original: ['BEIRUT (Reuters) - Jihadists launched an offensive against government-held parts of northwestern Syria near Hama on Tuesday in their biggest attack there since March, triggering heavy air strikes on rebel territory, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said.', 'The insurgent attack north of Hama revived hostilities in the northwestern region near the Turkish border that has been relatively calm in recent months as Russian-led diplomacy seeks to shore up ceasefires in western Syria.']
Paraphrased: ['Jihadist forces initiated a major offensive against government-controlled areas in northwestern Syria near Hama on Tuesday, marking their largest attack in the region since March. The offensive triggered intense aerial bombardments on rebel territory, according to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.', 'The recent insurgent attack to the north of Hama has reignited conflicts in the northwestern region near the Turkish border, which had previously experienced a relative lull in hostilities due to Russian-led diplomatic efforts to establish ceasefires in western Syria.']

Original: ['QAMISHLI, Syria (Reuters) - Kurdish-led authorities held local elections on Friday in areas they control in northern Syria, pushing ahead with autonomy plans opposed by both the government of President Bashar al-Assad and by Turkey.', 'The Iraqi Kurdish authorities, whose own plans for independence were met with a swift backlash from states in the region in the past two months, have previously been hostile to the Syrian Kurdish parties.']
Paraphrased: ['Kurdish-led officials oversaw local elections on Friday in territories under their control in northern Syria, despite opposition from both the government of President Bashar al-Assad and Turkey, which opposes the Kurdish-led autonomous plans.', 'The Iraqi Kurdish government, which has faced opposition from neighboring states in the past two months due to its own plans for independence, has historically been at odds with Syrian Kurdish groups.']

Original: ['BRUSSELS (Reuters) - The European Union is set to agree on Monday to ban business ties with North Korea, part of a new package of sanctions to isolate Pyongyang over its nuclear and missile programs.', 'Diplomats said that if Pyongyang launches more missiles, the EU could consider imposing sanctions on non-EU firms doing business with Pyongyang, as the United States has done.']
Paraphrased: ['The European Union is expected to approve a measure on Monday that would cut off business ties with North Korea as part of a broader package of sanctions aimed at isolating the regime over its nuclear and ballistic missile programs.', 'According to diplomats, if North Korea launches additional missiles, the European Union may consider imposing sanctions on non-EU companies that engage in business with Pyongyang, similar to the approach taken by the United States.']

Original: ['NEW YORK (Reuters) - The television audience for Thursday’s restrained Republican Party presidential debate on CNN was down from last week’s figures, according to preliminary Nielsen data on Friday.', 'The size of the audience in millions is expected to be available from Nielsen later on Friday.']
Paraphrased: ["According to early Nielsen data released on Friday, the viewership for the Republican Party presidential debate on CNN last Thursday was lower than the previous week's numbers.", 'Nielsen is expected to release audience size figures in millions later on Friday.']

Original: ['DUBLIN (Reuters) - Ireland s finance minister said the prospect of an election and period without government during Brexit talks is unconscionable, telling the party propping the government up that it needed to be aware of the consequences of causing an election.', 'At a time when issues and decisions will need to be made that will reverberate in our country for decades to come, the prospect of either an election taking place or a government not being in place afterwards is actually unconscionable,  Paschal Donohoe told national broadcaster RTE.']
Paraphrased: ["DUBLIN (Reuters) - Ireland's finance minister expressed deep concern about the potential for an election and political instability during Brexit negotiations, urging the party supporting the government to consider the potential consequences of their actions.", "As our nation faces far-reaching decisions that will shape our future for decades, the possibility of either holding an election or having no government in place afterwards is morally indefensible, according to Paschal Donohoe's statement to RTE."]

Original: ['The FAZ said May, who flew in for a hastily announced dinner in Brussels with the European Commission president last Monday ahead of an EU summit, seemed to Juncker  anxious, despondent and disheartened ,  a woman who trusts hardly anyone but is also not ready for a clear-out to free herself .', 'Some said they understood May s difficulties in forging consensus in London.']
Paraphrased: ['According to the FAZ, May appeared to be feeling anxious, downbeat, and disillusioned during a hastily arranged dinner with the European Commission president in Brussels last Monday, before an EU summit. Despite her reservations about trusting others, she is not prepared to make significant changes to free herself from her current situation.', "Some acknowledged May's challenges in achieving unanimity among London leaders."]

Original: ['JERUSALEM (Reuters) - Israel on Thursday expressed disappointment at the decision of U.S. President Donald Trump to sign a waiver to delay relocating the U.S. Embassy in Israel to Jerusalem from Tel Aviv but said it hoped a move could take place later.', '“Though Israel is disappointed that the embassy will not move at this time, we appreciate today’s expression of President Trump’s friendship to Israel and his commitment to moving the embassy in the future,” part of a statement from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said.']
Paraphrased: ["Israel was dismayed by US President Donald Trump's decision to postpone the relocation of the US embassy in Israel from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem, but nevertheless held out hope that the move might still take place at a later time.", '"Although Israel is disappointed that the embassy will not be relocated at this time, we value President Trump\'s show of support and commitment to moving the embassy in the future."']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Barack Obama and Mexican President Enrique Peña Nieto discussed immigration from Central America and the fight against heroin production during a phone call on Thursday, the White House said.', '“The leaders committed to continue working jointly to address irregular migration from Central America,” the White House said in a statement.']
Paraphrased: ['During a phone call on Thursday, U.S. President Barack Obama and Mexican President Enrique Peña Nieto talked about the ongoing issue of immigration from Central America and the efforts to combat the production of heroin.', 'The White House affirmed its commitment to collaborate with Central American leaders to address the ongoing issue of irregular migration.']

Original: ['SITTWE, Myanmar (Reuters) - Thousands of Rohingya Muslims trapped by hostile Buddhists in northwestern Myanmar have enough food and will not be granted the safe passage they requested from two remote villages, a senior government official said on Tuesday.', 'The Office of the United Nations Resident Coordinator in Myanmar told Reuters it was  aware and concerned  about the situation and was discussing it with the Myanmar government.']
Paraphrased: ['According to a senior government official, thousands of Rohingya Muslims who are currently surrounded by hostile Buddhists in northwestern Myanmar have access to enough food and will not be allowed to leave two remote villages safely.', 'The United Nations Resident Coordinator in Myanmar has informed Reuters that they are aware of the situation and are in talks with the Myanmar government to address their concerns.']

Original: ['BELGRADE (Reuters) - British Foreign\xa0Secretary Boris Johnson, setting aside his previous hostility toward Donald Trump, said on Thursday the U.S. Republican’s presidential election victory offered economic opportunities and there was no need for Europeans to be despondent about it.', '“I may respectfully say to my European friends and colleagues that it’s time we snapped out of general doom and gloom about this election,” Johnson said after meeting Serbian Prime Minister Aleksandar Vucic.']
Paraphrased: ["British Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson, previously opposed to Donald Trump, expressed optimism about the economic opportunities presented by Trump's presidential victory, assuring Europeans that there was no reason to be discouraged.", '"Johnson politely suggested to his European friends and colleagues that it\'s time to move away from a negative outlook on this election."']

Original: ['WASHINGTON/NEW YORK (Reuters) - Backers of Republican presidential hopeful Marco Rubio have spent nearly as much money in the weeks leading up to Super Tuesday’s nominating contests as all of his rivals combined, including an outsized spend in Texas.', "Senator Cruz's home state of Texas, the biggest prize among the Super Tuesday states in terms of the number of delegates up for grabs."]
Paraphrased: ["Marco Rubio's supporters have invested almost as much money in the weeks leading up to Super Tuesday's primaries as all of his opponents combined, with a particularly significant expenditure in Texas.", "Texas, Senator Cruz's home state and the state with the most delegates at stake, is the most valuable prize on Super Tuesday."]

Original: ['MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu and U.S.', 'Ambassador to Russia Jon Huntsman met on Thursday to discuss bilateral relations and international security issues, TASS news agency cited Russia s defense ministry as saying.']
Paraphrased: ['MOSCOW (Reuters) - According to a Reuters report, Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu met with a high-ranking official from the United States.', "According to Russia's defense ministry, as reported by TASS news agency, Ambassador to Russia Jon Huntsman met on Thursday to discuss matters of mutual interest, including bilateral relations and international security issues."]

Original: ['(Reuters) - A reporter for the conservative website Breitbart News filed a criminal complaint on Friday against Republican presidential election front-runner Donald Trump’s campaign manager, saying he grabbed her arm at a rally with such force that he left bruises.', 'The accusation prompted a flurry of exchanges between Trump’s campaign and Fields.']
Paraphrased: ["According to a report by Reuters, a journalist for the conservative news outlet Breitbart News alleged that Donald Trump's campaign manager physically assaulted her at a rally, leaving visible bruises on her arm.", "The allegation triggered a series of heated exchanges between Trump's campaign and Fields."]

Original: ['LIMA (Reuters) - The center-right government of Peru s embattled President Pedro Pablo Kuczynski canceled its scheduled auction of a $2 billion copper project, Michiquillay, on Wednesday amid a growing political crisis, two government sources said.', 'The regional bloc Organization of American States said earlier on Wednesday that it was preparing to send a delegation to Peru, the world s second biggest copper producer, to observe the  political situation  at the request of Kuczynski ahead of a vote in Congress to oust him on Thursday.']
Paraphrased: ["Peru's center-right government, led by embattled President Pedro Pablo Kuczynski, abruptly canceled the auction of a $2 billion copper project, Michiquillay, on Wednesday as a political crisis intensified, according to two government sources.", 'The Organization of American States is planning to send a delegation to Peru at the request of President Kuczynski to observe the political situation ahead of a Congressional vote to remove him from office on Thursday.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The FBI plans to hand over some of its notes from its interview with U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton regarding her use of private email while secretary of state to news outlets that requested them, CNN reported on Tuesday.', 'In addition to the notes, CNN said the FBI will give the news outlets the roughly 30-page report it sent to the U.S. Department of Justice last month when it recommended against pursuing criminal charges against Clinton, who is vying for the White House in the Nov. 8 U.S. election.']
Paraphrased: ['The FBI is set to provide some of its records from its conversation with Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton about her use of private email while serving as secretary of state to media outlets that have requested them, according to CNN.', 'The FBI will provide news outlets with a 30-page report it sent to the Justice Department last month, in which it recommended against pursuing criminal charges against Hillary Clinton, who is running for president in the November 8 election.']

Original: ['YOU RE THE ONE WHO SAYS I M DYING?', 'In return, he remarked with a smile:  Aargh, so you are the man who has been reporting that I am dying?']
Paraphrased: ['YOU ARE THE ONE WHO IS SAYING I AM DYING?', 'He responded with a smile, "Ah, so you\'re the one who\'s been saying I\'m on my deathbed?"']

Original: ['SEOUL (Reuters) - Ten North Koreans, including a four-year-old child, have been detained in China, where they face being deported back to the North, two sources with direct knowledge of the situation told Reuters.', 'South Korean foreign ministry spokesman Roh Kyu-deok said Seoul was  closely monitoring  the latest case of the 10 North Koreans in China.']
Paraphrased: ['According to Reuters, Chinese authorities have detained ten North Koreans, including a young child aged four, and are considering deporting them back to North Korea.', 'Seoul is carefully observing the recent situation involving ten North Koreans in China.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Top aides to President Donald Trump demurred on Sunday over where U.S. policy on Syria was headed after last week’s retaliatory missile strike, leaving open questions about whether removing Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad from power was now one of Trump’s goals.', 'Trump ordered the missile strikes on the Syrian air base after blaming Assad for the chemical weapons attack, which killed at least 70 people, many of them children, in the Syrian town of Khan Sheikhoun.']
Paraphrased: ["Trump's top advisors declined to clarify the direction of US policy on Syria following last week's missile strike, leaving uncertainty about whether ousting President Bashar al-Assad is now a goal of the administration.", 'Trump authorized the launch of missile strikes on the Syrian air base in response to the chemical weapons attack that killed at least 70 people, including numerous children, in the town of Khan Sheikhoun, and he held Assad responsible for the attack.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Barack Obama said on Friday that globalization is a fact that “we’re not going to be able to build a wall around” but that it was important to work to shape the process so that it benefits not just big companies but small firms as well.', 'The U.S. leader, speaking at a news conference with Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto, said the Trans Pacific Partnership trade deal currently being worked on has taken into account some of the weaknesses and criticisms of the North American Free Trade Agreement and sought to address those.']
Paraphrased: ["President Barack Obama acknowledged on Friday that globalization is an inevitable reality, stating that it's impossible to isolate ourselves from the global economy. However, he emphasized the importance of shaping this process to ensure that it benefits not just large corporations, but also small businesses and the wider community.", 'The U.S. leader, addressing a joint news conference with Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto, asserted that the ongoing Trans Pacific Partnership trade agreement has considered and addressed several shortcomings and criticisms of the North American Free Trade Agreement.']

Original: ['LONDON (Reuters) - Britain s Brexit minister David Davis said on Tuesday that reaching a deal with the European Union was the most likely outcome of talks, but added that the British government was prepared for no agreement with the bloc.', 'I don t think it would be in the interest for either side for there to be no deal.']
Paraphrased: ["According to Britain's Brexit minister David Davis, the most probable outcome of the negotiations with the European Union is a mutually beneficial agreement, but the British government is also prepared for the possibility of no deal with the bloc.", 'Neither side would benefit from the absence of a deal.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Republican presidential candidate Chris Christie has dismissed him as a puppet and former mentor Jeb Bush called him not fit to serve as up-and-coming Republican Marco Rubio becomes the man to beat in next week’s New Hampshire primary.', 'On Wednesday he took out a full-page ad in a leading New Hampshire newspaper, the Union-Leader, attacking Rubio as not ready to serve as commander in chief.']
Paraphrased: ["According to Reuters, Republican presidential candidate Chris Christie has dismissed his former mentor Jeb Bush as a puppet, while Bush has called Rubio unfit to serve, as Rubio gains momentum in next week's New Hampshire primary.", "He launched a scathing attack on Rubio in a full-page advertisement in the Union-Leader, a prominent New Hampshire newspaper, questioning the senator's fitness to serve as commander in chief."]

Original: ['Steve Mnuchin and Wilbur Ross are being considered for Treasury and Commerce.', 'Icahn, a close ally of Trump who was often praised by the Republican during the presidential campaign for his business acumen, also tweeted that both Mnuchin and Ross were friends and “two of the smartest people I know.” Mnuchin, a former Goldman Sachs partner and Trump’s campaign finance manager, has been considered a front-runner for the Treasury post for much of the past week since Trump’s stunning election victory.']
Paraphrased: ['Steve Mnuchin and Wilbur Ross are under consideration for the positions of Treasury Secretary and Commerce Secretary, respectively.', "Icahn, a trusted advisor of Trump and frequent praiser of his business prowess during the presidential campaign, also tweeted that both Mnuchin and Ross were close friends and highly intelligent individuals. Mnuchin, a former Goldman Sachs partner and Trump's campaign finance manager, has been a top contender for the Treasury position for much of the past week since Trump's surprise election victory."]

Original: ['ABUJA (Reuters) - The minister for Nigeria s oil-producing Delta region said on Monday the government was ready to meet militants days after they called off a year-long ceasefire.', 'If the Avengers wants to meet with us, we are ready to meet with them ... We are at all times ready to engage them and other groups and stakeholders,  Usani told reporters at the presidential villa in Abuja.']
Paraphrased: ['The Nigerian government is prepared to engage with militants in the oil-rich Delta region following their decision to end a year-long ceasefire, according to the minister responsible for the area.', 'If the Avengers desire to meet with us, we are always prepared to engage with them and other relevant parties, as stated by Usani to reporters at the presidential villa in Abuja.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump’s son-in-law and close adviser, Jared Kushner, had at least three previously undisclosed contacts with the Russian ambassador to the United States during and after the 2016 presidential campaign, seven current and former U.S. officials told Reuters.', 'Before the election, Kislyak’s undisclosed discussions with Kushner and Flynn\xa0focused on fighting terrorism and improving U.S.-Russian economic relations, six of the sources said.']
Paraphrased: ["According to seven current and former U.S. officials, Jared Kushner, President Donald Trump's son-in-law and trusted advisor, had at least three previously undisclosed interactions with the Russian ambassador to the United States during and after the 2016 presidential campaign.", 'According to six sources, Kislyak held private talks with Kushner and Flynn before the election that focused on strategies to combat terrorism and enhance economic ties between the US and Russia.']

Original: ['OTTAWA (Reuters) - Canada will impose targeted sanctions against 40 Venezuelan senior officials, including President Nicol s Maduro, to punish them for  anti-democratic behavior,  the foreign ministry said on Friday.', 'The United States imposed sanctions on Maduro in late July and has also targeted around 30 other officials.']
Paraphrased: ["Canada will levy targeted sanctions against 40 high-ranking Venezuelan officials, including President Nicolás Maduro, as a means of punishing them for their undemocratic actions, according to the Canadian foreign ministry's statement on Friday.", 'The US government imposed economic sanctions on President Maduro in late July, and also targeted around 30 other high-ranking officials.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Barack Obama will speak with European leaders about the Syrian refugee crisis, Russia and Ukraine, and the aftermath of Britain’s decision to pull out of the EU during the NATO summit on Friday, the White House said.', 'Speaking with reporters aboard Air Force One on Thursday en route to the summit in Warsaw, White House spokesman Josh Earnest also said Obama and Russian President Vladimir Putin did not reach any agreement for new cooperation in Syria during a phone call they held on Wednesday.']
Paraphrased: ['President Barack Obama is expected to discuss the ongoing Syrian refugee crisis, as well as the conflicts in Russia and Ukraine, with European leaders during the upcoming NATO summit on Friday, according to the White House.', 'During a conversation with reporters on Air Force One, White House spokesperson Josh Earnest revealed that there was no agreement reached between President Obama and Russian President Vladimir Putin regarding new cooperation in Syria during their phone call on Wednesday.']

Original: ['ANKARA (Reuters) - Turkey is investigating reports that 11 Turkish folk dancers applied for asylum after attending a folk dance festival in the Hungarian capital Budapest, state-run news agency Anadolu said.', 'It was not clear where the remaining dancers may have sought asylum.']
Paraphrased: ['Turkey is looking into claims that 11 Turkish folk dancers sought refugee status after participating in a folk dance festival in Budapest, Hungary, according to a report by the state-run Anadolu news agency.', "The dancers' whereabouts after the performance were uncertain."]

Original: ['Ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley said on Friday she did not want to take the job of Secretary of State Rex Tillerson, whose tenure has been dogged by rumors of rifts with President Donald Trump.', 'The focus is, I really want to do a good job now in what I’m doing.” “We have a secretary of state.']
Paraphrased: ['Nikki Haley, the Ambassador to the United Nations, dismissed the idea of taking over as Secretary of State, a position currently held by Rex Tillerson, whose time in office has been marked by speculation about tensions with President Donald Trump.', '"My primary objective at present is to excel in my current responsibilities."']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A federal grand jury in Washington on Friday approved the first charges in the investigation led by special counsel Robert Mueller into alleged Russian meddling in the 2016 U.S. presidential election, a source briefed on the matter told Reuters.', 'The filing of the sealed charges was first reported by CNN.']
Paraphrased: ['According to a source familiar with the matter, a federal grand jury in Washington on Friday approved the first set of charges in the investigation led by special counsel Robert Mueller into alleged Russian interference in the 2016 U.S. presidential election.', 'CNN was the first to report on the filing of the sealed charges.']

Original: ['Trump has portrayed himself as the “law-and-order” candidate.', 'In Washington, White House spokesman John Earnest pointed to what he said was a contradiction in Trump’s remarks.']
Paraphrased: ['Trump has presented himself as the champion of strict adherence to the law.', "White House spokesman John Earnest highlighted a perceived inconsistency in President Trump's statements."]

Original: ['(Reuters) - The communications director for U.S. Senate candidate Roy Moore has resigned amid the Alabama Republican’s efforts to combat allegations of sexual misconduct that have roiled his campaign.', '“As we all know, campaigns make changes throughout the duration of the campaign,” campaign Chairman Bill Armistead said in a statement on Wednesday.']
Paraphrased: ["The communications director for Roy Moore's U.S. Senate campaign has stepped down as Moore faces allegations of sexual misconduct and struggles to maintain his candidacy.", '"According to Campaign Chairman Bill Armistead, campaigns are subject to changes throughout their duration, as stated in his Wednesday statement."']

Original: ['HAVANA (Reuters) - The United States  decision to reduce staff at its Havana embassy was hasty and will affect bilateral relations, Cuba s Foreign Ministry chief for U.S. Affairs Josefina Vidal said on Friday.', 'We consider the decision announced today by the U.S. government through the State Department is hasty and will affect bilateral relations,  Vidal said in a briefing broadcast on state-run television during the midday news show.']
Paraphrased: ["According to Cuba's Foreign Ministry chief for U.S. Affairs Josefina Vidal, the United States' hasty decision to downsize its diplomatic staff in Havana will have a negative impact on bilateral relations between the two countries.", "According to Vidal, the U.S. government's hasty decision announced today through the State Department will have a negative impact on bilateral relations, as stated during a briefing broadcast on state-run television during the midday news show."]

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Congressional Republicans on Friday unveiled the final version of their dramatic U.S. tax overhaul - debt-financed cuts for businesses, the wealthy and some middle-class Americans - and picked up crucial support from two wavering senators ahead of planned votes by lawmakers early next week.', 'It would cut the corporate income tax rate to 21 percent from 35 percent, according to a summary distributed to reporters by congressional tax writers.']
Paraphrased: ['Congressional Republicans revealed the final version of their sweeping tax overhaul on Friday, which includes debt-financed cuts for businesses, the wealthy, and some middle-class Americans. The plan picked up key support from two undecided senators ahead of scheduled votes next week.', 'The proposed tax plan would reduce the corporate income tax rate from 35% to 21%, as outlined in a document provided to journalists by lawmakers responsible for crafting the tax legislation.']

Original: ['PARIS (Reuters) - From text messages at 2 a.m. to clockwork meetings and tight deadlines, 39-year-old Emmanuel Macron is shaking up how the French presidency is run, raising the tempo and stretching the limits of the largely youthful team around him.', 'The area where Macron s high-tempo agenda is proving less successful so far is euro zone financial reform.']
Paraphrased: ["Under Macron's leadership, the French presidency is experiencing a significant shift in its operational style, with a faster-paced and more demanding approach that is pushing the limits of his young team.", "Macron's ambitious agenda has encountered difficulties in the area of euro zone financial reform, where progress has been slower than expected."]

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Barack Obama on Sunday said Americans would stand united and “not give in to fear or turn against each other” in the wake of a nightclub shooting in Orlando, Florida, that killed 50 people.', 'We will not give in to fear or turn against each other.']
Paraphrased: ['President Barack Obama emphasized on Sunday that the American people would stand together and resist the temptation to give in to fear or turn against each other in the aftermath of the tragic nightclub shooting in Orlando, Florida, which claimed the lives of 50 innocent individuals.', 'We will stand firm against fear and solidify our unity.']

Original: ['CAIRO (Reuters) - Amnesty International urged Egyptian authorities on Tuesday to release 24 Nubian activists detained last week on charges of protesting without permission as they rallied for resettlement on the banks of the Nile river.', 'Egyptian authorities have long since marginalized Nubians, ignoring their demands to return to their historical lands and treating Nubian activism as suspicious on security grounds,  Amnesty International s North Africa Campaigns Director Najia Bounaim said in a statement.']
Paraphrased: ['Amnesty International has called on Egyptian authorities to immediately release the 24 Nubian activists who were detained last week for protesting without permission as they demanded resettlement in areas along the Nile river.', "According to Amnesty International's North Africa Campaigns Director Najia Bounaim, the Egyptian authorities have historically sidelined Nubians, dismissing their requests to return to their ancestral lands and viewing Nubian activism as a threat to national security."]

Original: ['TOKYO (Reuters) - Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe urged North Korea on Monday to refrain from taking further provocative actions, comply with U.N. resolutions and abandon its nuclear missile development.', 'He also said the government was considering measures to respond to contingencies stemming from a potential crisis on the Korean peninsula, including floods of refugees and how to evacuate Japanese citizens from South Korea.']
Paraphrased: ['Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe called on North Korea to avoid engaging in any further aggressive behavior, comply with United Nations resolutions, and give up its development of nuclear missiles.', 'He additionally mentioned that the government was exploring contingency plans to address possible consequences of a crisis on the Korean peninsula, such as an influx of refugees and the evacuation of Japanese citizens from South Korea.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Washington State Attorney General Bob Ferguson said on Sunday he will depose Trump administration officials to uncover “what truly motivated” President Donald Trump’s executive order on immigration if the case he brought against it goes to trial.', 'Documents and emails authored by administration officials may contain evidence that the order was an unconstitutional attempt to ban Muslims from entering the United States, and Ferguson will use “every tool” at his disposal to bring those to light, he told ABC’s “This Week.”']
Paraphrased: ["Washington State Attorney General Bob Ferguson plans to question Trump administration officials under oath to uncover the real reasons behind President Donald Trump's controversial immigration order if the case goes to trial.", 'According to Ferguson, documents and emails written by administration officials may reveal that the order was an unconstitutional attempt to ban Muslims from entering the US, and he will use all available resources to uncover this information.']

Original: ['BHUBANESWAR, India (Reuters) - Flames swept through an illegal firecracker workshop in the eastern Indian state of Odisha on Wednesday, killing at least six people, police said.', 'Local television channels showed fire and smoke billowing out of the workshop in a cottage in Bahabalpur village, about 200 km (120 miles) from state capital Bhubaneswar.']
Paraphrased: ['At least six people lost their lives when a fire engulfed an unauthorized fireworks factory in the eastern Indian state of Odisha on Wednesday, according to police reports.', 'Television channels broadcast footage of flames and smoke pouring out of a workshop in Bahabalpur village, located approximately 200 kilometers (120 miles) from the state capital Bhubaneswar.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A Kurdish referendum for independence has decreased focus on fighting Islamic State militants in Iraq, a spokesman for the U.S.-led coalition fighting the militant group said.', 'The focus which used to be like a laser beam on ISIS is now not 100 percent there, so there has been an effect on the overall mission to defeat ISIS in Iraq as a result of the referendum,  said coalition spokesman Colonel Ryan Dillon, using an acronym for Islamic State.']
Paraphrased: ['According to a spokesman for the U.S.-led coalition fighting Islamic State militants, the recent Kurdish referendum on independence has diverted attention away from the ongoing battle against the extremist group in Iraq.', "The coalition's concentration on defeating ISIS in Iraq has been diluted due to the referendum, as stated by Colonel Ryan Dillon, resulting in a less than 100% focus on the overall mission to defeat the terrorist group."]

Original: ['(Reuters) - U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said on Thursday he would nominate retired Marine Corps General James Mattis for defense secretary, the latest of about a dozen picks he has announced for high-level positions since winning the Nov. 8 presidential election.', 'Below are people mentioned as contenders for senior roles as Trump works to form his administration before taking office on Jan. 20, according to Reuters sources and media reports.']
Paraphrased: ['According to Reuters, President-elect Donald Trump announced on Thursday that he intends to nominate retired Marine Corps General James Mattis as his defense secretary, marking the latest in a series of high-level appointments he has made since winning the November 8 election.', "According to Reuters sources and media reports, several individuals are being considered for senior positions in Trump's administration, which he is expected to fill before taking office on January 20th."]

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Republican Senator Marco Rubio on Monday said he will vote to back President Donald Trump’s nominee for secretary of state, Rex Tillerson, despite the former Exxon Mobil Corp CEO’s “troubling” responses before lawmakers regarding Russia.', '“Despite my reservations, I will support Mr. Tillerson’s nomination in committee and in the full Senate,” Rubio said in a statement posted on Facebook ahead of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee’s vote on Tillerson later on Monday.']
Paraphrased: ["U.S. Senator Marco Rubio (R-FL) announced on Monday that he will support President Donald Trump's nominee for secretary of state, Rex Tillerson, despite having reservations about Tillerson's previous responses to lawmakers regarding Russia.", "Rubio announced on Facebook that he would back Mr. Tillerson's nomination in committee and in the full Senate, despite having some reservations, before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee's vote on Monday."]

Original: ['AMSTERDAM (Reuters) - A Dutchman wielding a knife was shot by military police on Friday at Amsterdam s Schiphol Airport and taken into custody, an official said.', 'The man had made threats with a knife and was shot at the central plaza of Schiphol airport, an area with shops and restaurants, spokesman Stan Verberkt said.']
Paraphrased: ["A man wielding a knife was shot and apprehended by military police at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport on Friday, according to an official statement.", 'According to spokesman Stan Verberkt, a man had made threatening gestures with a knife at the central plaza of Schiphol airport, which is home to various shops and eateries, before being shot.']

Original: ['GUATEMALA CITY (Reuters) - The Guatemalan unit of telecommunications firm Telefonica SA suspended its customer service operations and closed its shops over the weekend after three of its employees were shot to death in the Central American nation.', 'Movistar has 4 million clients in Guatemala.']
Paraphrased: ["Telefonica SA's Guatemalan division suspended its customer service operations and closed its retail locations over the weekend after three of its employees were killed in Central America.", 'Movistar serves approximately 4 million customers in Guatemala.']

Original: ['GENEVA/BEIRUT (Reuters) - Syria s government delegation quit U.N.-led peace talks in Geneva on Friday and said it would not return next week unless the opposition withdrew a statement demanding President Bashar al-Assad play no role in any interim post-war government.', 'Pressed whether the government delegation would return to Geneva next week, Ja afari replied:  Damascus will decide.']
Paraphrased: ['The Syrian government delegation walked out of UN-mediated peace talks in Geneva on Friday and declared that they would not return next week unless the opposition retracted their statement calling for President Bashar al-Assad to have no role in any future interim government.', 'Ja afari responded that the decision to return to Geneva next week would be made by Damascus.']

Original: ['Fed officials already say their plan to gradually increase interest rates may need to be accelerated to accommodate the new administration’s economic proposals, which could push inflation higher.', 'Yet for the Fed, Trump’s victory brings a new and possibly unnerving sort of uncertainty.']
Paraphrased: ["Fed officials may need to speed up their plan to raise interest rates in response to the new administration's economic policies, which could lead to higher inflation.", "The Federal Reserve faces a novel and potentially disquieting level of uncertainty in the wake of Trump's victory."]

Original: ['CHICAGO (Reuters) - Illinois’ long-running budget impasse stung the state on Thursday in the U.S. municipal market where buyers of its $550 million bond issue demanded bigger yields over the market benchmark.', 'It was also wider than the 154 basis-point spread in 10 years for Illinois’ $480 million GO bond sale in January.']
Paraphrased: ["Illinois' ongoing budget stalemate had a negative impact on the state's bond market on Thursday, as investors demanded higher yields on the state's $550 million bond issue compared to the benchmark market rate.", "The bond sale in January for Illinois' $480 million GO bonds had a wider spread of 154 basis points compared to the previous sale."]

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Barack Obama will host Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi for an official visit on Oct. 18, the White House said on Monday.', 'Renzi and his wife, Agnese Landini, will be guests at a state dinner on the evening of the visit, Earnest said.']
Paraphrased: ['President Barack Obama will welcome Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi to the White House on October 18th, according to a statement released by the White House on Monday.', 'According to Earnest, Renzi and his wife Agnese Landini will be honored guests at a formal dinner hosted by the state during their visit.']

Original: ['DHAKA,  (Reuters) - Bangladesh and Myanmar agreed on Monday to set up a  joint working group  on the repatriation of Rohingya Muslim refugee who have fled to Bangladesh, Foreign Minister Abul Hassan Mahmood Ali told reporters after talks with a Myanmar official.', 'More than half a million Rohingya refugees from Myanmar have fled to neighboring Bangladesh since late August, to escape what the United Nations has branded ethnic cleansing by Myanmar s military.']
Paraphrased: ['DHAKA - Bangladesh and Myanmar have agreed to establish a joint committee to oversee the return of Rohingya Muslim refugees who have fled to Bangladesh, according to Foreign Minister Abul Hassan Mahmood Ali.', "Over 500,000 Rohingya refugees from Myanmar have sought refuge in Bangladesh since late August, fleeing a campaign of ethnic cleansing perpetrated by Myanmar's military, as deemed by the United Nations."]

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. House Speaker Paul Ryan invited Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday to address a joint meeting of Congress when he visits Washington in June, an unusual show of warmth for a foreign leader.', 'Opportunities to address the House and Senate are considered a great honor.']
Paraphrased: ['House Speaker Paul Ryan extended a rare invitation to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address a joint session of Congress during his upcoming visit to Washington in June, demonstrating a notable display of warmth towards a foreign leader.', 'Speaking before the House and Senate is considered a prestigious privilege.']

Original: ['But widespread anger over the crackdown on the referendum, declared illegal by Madrid, now makes any such strategy politically risky, given it would be unlikely to sustain broad support from independence supporters and from within Puigdemont s own ruling coalition in the Catalan parliament.', 'As a condition, it forced out Artur Mas as Catalan leader for Puigdemont due to the lack of progress toward independence since the 2014 vote.']
Paraphrased: ["The recent crackdown on the referendum by Madrid has sparked widespread anger, making it politically risky for any strategy that relies on broad support from independence supporters and within Puigdemont's ruling coalition in the Catalan parliament.", 'The condition led to the ousting of Artur Mas as Catalan leader in favor of Puigdemont due to the lack of progress toward independence since the 2014 referendum.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The Republican Party’s Senate campaign wing has severed its fundraising deal with Alabama Republican Senate nominee Roy Moore, Politico reported on Friday, a day after allegations emerged that he initiated a sexual encounter with a 14-year-old girl when he was 32.', 'Politico said Federal Election Commission paperwork filed on Friday showed the National Republican Senatorial Committee was no longer listed as part of a joint fundraising committee with the campaign of Moore, who is now 70, or the Alabama Republican Party and the Republican National Committee.']
Paraphrased: ["The Republican Party's Senate campaign arm has ended its fundraising partnership with Alabama Republican Senate candidate Roy Moore, according to Politico, after allegations emerged that he engaged in a sexual encounter with a 14-year-old girl when he was 32 years old.", 'According to Politico, the National Republican Senatorial Committee is no longer participating in a joint fundraising committee with the campaign of Roy Moore, who is now 70, or the Alabama Republican Party and the Republican National Committee, as indicated in FEC paperwork filed on Friday.']

Original: ['NEW YORK (Reuters) - Democrats beat Republicans in U.S. television ratings, according to Nielsen data released on Tuesday for the first night of the Democratic National Convention.', 'All in all, some 23 million Americans watched the first night of the Republican convention last week - in line with the audience for the 2012 gathering.']
Paraphrased: ['Democrats outperformed Republicans in television ratings during the first night of the Democratic National Convention, as reported by Nielsen data released on Tuesday.', 'In total, approximately 23 million Americans tuned in to the initial night of the Republican convention last week, which is comparable to the viewership of the 2012 event.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States is closely watching the situation in Saudi Arabia amid reported asset agreements between Saudi authorities and some detainees in an anti-corruption crackdown, U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday.', 'Asked about the agreements to hand over wealth for detainees  freedom, Mnuchin told CNBC  I think that the Crown Prince (Mohammed bin Salman) is doing a great job at transforming the country,  adding that the United States was  obviously monitoring the situation.']
Paraphrased: ['The US is closely monitoring the situation in Saudi Arabia as reports suggest that Saudi authorities have reached asset agreements with some detainees in an ongoing anti-corruption crackdown, according to US Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin.', 'Mnuchin praised Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for his efforts to modernize Saudi Arabia, noting that the US is closely following the situation.']

Original: ['ROME (Reuters) - Italian magistrates are investigating whether a Treasury official sold confidential government information to her previous employers, Ernst & Young, two judicial sources involved in the case said on Wednesday.', 'Neither Ernst & Young s Italian office, nor lawyers representing the company, responded to requests for comment.']
Paraphrased: ['Italian prosecutors are looking into allegations that a senior government official leaked confidential information to her former employers at Ernst & Young, according to two sources familiar with the investigation.', "Neither Ernst & Young's Italian office nor the lawyers representing the company responded to requests for comment."]

Original: ['MADRID (Reuters) - The Spanish government on Friday passed measures to increase control over how Catalonia spends its money in an effort to stop the regional administration from using state cash to pay for an illegal independence referendum.', 'The wealthy northeastern region launched its official campaign for an independence referendum on Thursday in defiance of Madrid, which has declared the process illegal, and the Constitutional Court, which has suspended the vote.']
Paraphrased: ["The Spanish government on Friday implemented new controls to regulate Catalonia's financial expenditures, with the aim of preventing the regional administration from using state funds to finance an unauthorized independence referendum.", "The affluent northeastern region commenced its formal campaign for a self-determination referendum on Thursday, despite Madrid's disapproval and the Constitutional Court's suspension of the vote."]

Original: ['Over lunch in the Swedish city of Gothenburg on Friday, they discussed and gave political support to a European Commission proposal to create a European Education Area, in which the EU could help promote studies across its various nations.', 'Education is key, because it is education that ...helps us... develop a European identity,  Commissioner for Education Tibor Navracsics said.']
Paraphrased: ['During their Friday lunch in Gothenburg, Sweden, they explored and endorsed a European Commission plan to establish a European Education Area, where the EU could facilitate cross-national educational exchanges and promote academic studies.', 'Education is crucial, as it empowers us to cultivate a shared European identity, according to Commissioner for Education Tibor Navracsics.']

Original: ['BEIRUT (Reuters) - Syrian troops seized a suburb of the eastern city of Deir al-Zor on Sunday, tightening the noose around Islamic State, a Syrian military source said.', 'Russia s RIA news agency cited an unnamed source as saying the Syrian army had cut Islamic State s main supply line in Deir al-Zor city.']
Paraphrased: ['Syrian government forces captured a neighborhood in the eastern city of Deir al-Zor on Sunday, further compressing the territorial control of the Islamic State group in the area, according to a military source.', "According to an unnamed source cited by Russia's RIA news agency, the Syrian army has successfully severed the Islamic State's primary supply line within Deir al-Zor city."]

Original: ['WASHINGTON/WEST PAlM BEACH, Fla. (Reuters) - Democrat Hillary Clinton’s campaign will take part in a recount of Wisconsin votes in the U.S. presidential race, an effort Republican winner Donald Trump called “ridiculous” on Saturday.', 'Marc Elias, the Clinton campaign counsel, said the campaign would take part in the recount in Wisconsin as well as in the other battleground states of Pennsylvania and Michigan if recounts were mounted there.']
Paraphrased: ['Hillary Clinton\'s Democratic campaign will participate in a recount of Wisconsin votes in the US presidential election, a move that Donald Trump, the Republican winner, dismissed as "absurd" on Saturday.', "Marc Elias, the Clinton campaign's legal adviser, announced that the campaign would participate in recounts in Wisconsin, Pennsylvania, and Michigan if those states' electors initiated the process."]

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump is likely to nominate former Senate aide Hester Peirce to an open seat on the Securities and Exchange Commission, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.', 'Peirce is no stranger to the SEC.']
Paraphrased: ['According to Bloomberg News, President Trump is expected to appoint Hester Peirce, a former Senate aide, to a vacant seat on the Securities and Exchange Commission, based on information from unnamed sources familiar with the matter.', 'Peirce has prior experience in the SEC.']

Original: ['DUBLIN (Reuters) - Non-EU Norway called on Brussels and London on Wednesday to ensure that Brexit does not disrupt its trade relations once Britain leaves the European Union.', 'Norway is concerned, among other things, about the fate of Norwegians living in Britain after Brexit; fisheries policy; what kind of terms would be given to Britain after Brexit and whether Britain would get preferential treatment over Norway.']
Paraphrased: ["Norway urged Brussels and London to maintain stable trade relations with Norway after Britain's exit from the European Union, to avoid any potential disruptions caused by Brexit.", 'Norway is worried about the future of Norwegian citizens residing in the UK, as well as the potential impact of Brexit on fisheries policy and the terms of any post-Brexit agreement with the UK, including whether Britain would receive preferential treatment over Norway.']

Original: ['WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The top Democrat in the U.S. Senate predicted on Monday that Republicans would fall short of their stated goal of repealing former Democratic President Barack Obama’s signature healthcare law.', '“The odds are very high we will keep ACA,” Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer told reporters at a news conference, referring to the Affordable Care Act, which is commonly known as Obamacare.']
Paraphrased: ['According to the top Democrat in the U.S. Senate, Republicans are likely to fall short of their aim to completely repeal the landmark healthcare law passed under former Democratic President Barack Obama.', 'Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer expressed strong confidence that the Affordable Care Act (ACA), commonly referred to as Obamacare, will remain in effect, during a news conference with reporters.']
